intro: Lupinus lutzelburgianus, commonly known as the Lutzelburg lupine, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its erect, spindly stems and clusters of blue to purple pea-like flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces legume pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Lupinus lutzelburgianus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in nitrogen fixation in soil.
